text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Address S0..*AddressDados de Endereçamento
use S0..1codeUso do Endereço
type S0..1codeTipo de Endereço
text 0..0
Slices for line S1..*stringEndereço
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:extension.url
line:streetType 0..*stringTipo de Logradouro
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
iso21090-ADXP-streetNameType 0..*stringstreetNameType
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/iso21090-ADXP-streetNameType
value[x]:valueString 1..1stringValue of extension
Binding: Tipo de Logradouro (required)
line:street 1..1stringLogradouro
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
iso21090-ADXP-streetName 0..*stringstreetName
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/iso21090-ADXP-streetName
line:number 1..1stringNúmero
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
iso21090-ADXP-houseNumber 0..*stringhouseNumber
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/iso21090-ADXP-houseNumber
line:complement 0..*stringComplemento
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
iso21090-ADXP-additionalLocator 0..*stringadditionalLocator
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/iso21090-ADXP-additionalLocator
line:neighborhood 1..1stringBairro
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
BRBairro-1.0 0..*stringNome do bairro
URL: http://www.saude.gov.br/fhir/r4/StructureDefinition/BRBairro-1.0
city 1..1stringMunicípio
district 0..0
state S1..1stringUF
postalCode S1..1stringCEP
country 0..0
period S0..1PeriodPeríodo do Endereço
start S0..1dateTimeData de Inicio do Endereço
end S0..1dateTimeData de Término do Endereço

Documentation for this format

element.definition: Dados do(s) endereço(s) onde o sujeito do endereço pode ser localizado.
element.comment: Note: address is intended to describe postal addresses for administrative purposes, not to describe absolute geographical coordinates.  Postal addresses are often used as proxies for physical locations (also see the [Location](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/location.html#) resource).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
home: endereço residencial atual.
work: endereço comercial ou de trabalho atual.
temp: endereço temporário, como um hotel, a casa de amigos ou familiares, uma instalação/edificação provisória, etc.
old: endereço anterior.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an address is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.
element.requirements: Allows an appropriate address to be chosen from a list of many.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary or old address etc.for a current/permanent one

element.definition:
physical: um endereço físico de um edificação ou espaço geográfico real, como de uma casa, prédio, loja, galpão, lote, etc.
postal: um endereço virtual, como de uma Caixa Postal ou serviço de logística de mercadorias, p.ex.
element.comment: The definition of Address states that "address is intended to describe postal addresses, not physical locations". However, many applications track whether an address has a dual purpose of being a location that can be visited as well as being a valid delivery destination, and Postal addresses are often used as proxies for physical locations (also see the [Location](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/location.html#) resource).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

element.definition: Specifies the entire address as it should be displayed e.g. on a postal label. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
element.comment: Can provide both a text representation and parts. Applications updating an address SHALL ensure that  when both text and parts are present,  no content is included in the text that isn't found in a part.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 + XAD.3 + XAD.4 + XAD.5 + XAD.6

element.definition: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: Tipo de logradouro do endereço.
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The designation given to the street. (e.g. Street, Avenue, Crescent, etc.).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The actual value

Logradouro do endereço (ex.: Visconde do Rio Branco, das Laranjeiras, QRSW 8 Bloco A-1) . Quando não for possível utilizar o elemento streetType, incluir textualmente no início do nome do logradouro o tipo de logradouro abreviado (ex.: R. Visconde do Rio Branco, Av. das Laranjeiras, Quadra QRSW 8 Bloco A-1).
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: streetName.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Número do endereço.
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The number of a building, house or lot alongside the street. Also known as "primary street number". This does not number the street but rather the building.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Complemento do endereço, como o nome do edifício, bloco, número do apartamento, número da sala etc.
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: This can be a unit designator, such as apartment number, suite number, or floor. There may be several unit designators in an address (e.g., "3rd floor, Appt. 342"). This can also be a designator pointing away from the location, rather than specifying a smaller location within some larger one (e.g., Dutch "t.o." means "opposite to" for house boats located across the street facing houses).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Bairro do endereço.
element.orderMeaning: The order in which lines should appear in an address label

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: XAD.1 + XAD.2 (note: XAD.1 and XAD.2 have different meanings for a company address than for a person address)

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Nome do bairro.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The actual value
Município do endereço.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The name of the administrative area (county).
element.comment: District is sometimes known as county, but in some regions 'county' is used in place of city (municipality), so county name should be conveyed in city instead.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unidade Federativa (estados ou Distrito Federal) do endereço.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Código de Endereçamento Postal. Utilizar a máscara XXXXX-XXXX.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Country (e.g. can be ISO 3166 2 or 3 letter code)
element.definition: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.
element.comment: ISO 3166 3 letter codes can be used in place of a human readable country name.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Período em que o endereço foi utilizado.
element.requirements: Allows addresses to be placed in historical context.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Data em que o endereço foi cadastrado ou começou a ser utilizado.
element.comment: If the low element is missing, the meaning is that the low boundary is not known.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Data em que o endereço foi desativado ou parou de ser utilizado.
element.comment: The high value includes any matching date/time. i.e. 2012-02-03T10:00:00 is in a period that has an end value of 2012-02-03.
element.meaningWhenMissing: If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Dados do(s) endereço(s) onde o sujeito do endereço pode ser localizado.

home: endereço residencial atual.
work: endereço comercial ou de trabalho atual.
temp: endereço temporário, como um hotel, a casa de amigos ou familiares, uma instalação/edificação provisória, etc.
old: endereço anterior.

physical: um endereço físico de um edificação ou espaço geográfico real, como de uma casa, prédio, loja, galpão, lote, etc.
postal: um endereço virtual, como de uma Caixa Postal ou serviço de logística de mercadorias, p.ex.
Tipo de logradouro do endereço.

Logradouro do endereço (ex.: Visconde do Rio Branco, das Laranjeiras, QRSW 8 Bloco A-1) . Quando não for possível utilizar o elemento streetType, incluir textualmente no início do nome do logradouro o tipo de logradouro abreviado (ex.: R. Visconde do Rio Branco, Av. das Laranjeiras, Quadra QRSW 8 Bloco A-1).
Número do endereço.
Complemento do endereço, como o nome do edifício, bloco, número do apartamento, número da sala etc.
Bairro do endereço.
Município do endereço.
Unidade Federativa (estados ou Distrito Federal) do endereço.
Código de Endereçamento Postal. Utilizar a máscara XXXXX-XXXX.
Período em que o endereço foi utilizado.
Data em que o endereço foi cadastrado ou começou a ser utilizado.
Data em que o endereço foi desativado ou parou de ser utilizado.
